com.cmput301.cs.project.controllers

Class TagsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmput301.cs.project.controllers.TagsManager

  • public class TagsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls the tags that are shown in TagManagerActivity.

    Loads any locally saved claims from the LocalClaimSaver

    Use get(Context) to obtain the singleton. There are getter methods, as well as the search methods, for using either the name or the id to find the tag. You can also delete the tag by either its name or its id.

      • getTagByName

        public Tag getTagByName(java.lang.String name)
        Finds or creates a Tag with the supplied name. If a new Tag is created, TagsChangedListener.onTagCreated(Tag) is called after the creation.
        Parameters:
        name - non-null String name
        Returns:
        a non-null instance of Tag

      • findTagByName

        public Tag findTagByName(java.lang.String name)
        Finds an existing Tag with the supplied name. Returns null if none is found.
        Parameters:
        name - the String name; usually obtained by Tag.getName()
        Returns:
        an instance of Tag with the same name; null if not found

      • findTagById

        public Tag findTagById(java.lang.String id)
        Finds an existing Tag with the supplied id. Returns null if none is found.
        Parameters:
        id - the String id; usually obtained by Tag.getId()
        Returns:
        an instance of Tag with the same id; null if not found

      • renameTag

        public Tag renameTag(Tag oldTag,
            java.lang.String newName)
        Renames a Tag. A new instance of {code Tag} will be created with the same id. The old instance should be discarded. TagsChangedListener.onTagRenamed(Tag, Tag) is called after a successful removal.
        Parameters:
        oldTag - the Tag to be renamed
        newName - non-null String name
        Returns:
        a non-null instance of Tag with the same id

      • deleteTagById

        public void deleteTagById(java.lang.String id)
        Finds and deletes an existing Tag by its id. No-op if the tag is not found. TagsChangedListener.onTagDeleted(Tag) is called after a successful removal.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the Tag; usually obtained by Tag.getId()

      • deleteTagByName

        public void deleteTagByName(java.lang.String name)
        Finds and deletes an existing Tag by its name. No-op if the tag is not found. TagsChangedListener.onTagDeleted(Tag) is called after a successful removal.
        Parameters:
        name - id of the Tag; usually obtained by Tag.getName()

      • peekTags

        public java.util.SortedSet<Tag> peekTags()
        Peeks at all the existing Tags. Sorted by the natural order of Tag.
        Returns:
        unmodifiable SortedSet of Tags; sorted by Tag.compareTo(Tag)
